poem:
Title: Plums of Withdrawal

America, the eager plum,
Turns sour in Niger's sun -
A thousand golden seeds withdrawn.
Strategy replowed and undone.

Russia, the vine thrives,
In African fields, it dives. 
The West, an abandoned tree,
Basks in the shade of a fallen treaty. 

From the junta's clenched fist, 
Spills victory, like morning mist. 
Biden watches--a soft dawn, 
A soil to plant anew upon.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US to withdraw from Niger after security pact fails in strategic victory for Russia The US will withdraw more than 1,000 military personnel from Niger in a move that will force the Biden administration to rethink its counter-terrorism strategy and amounts to a strategic victory for Russia. The decision comes a month after the west African country’s ruling military junta revoked a security pact with Washington that had allowed American forces on its soil to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
